pageContext.claim: “You have one of the dumbest governors [Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp] in the United States. And you know when I endorsed him, and I didn't know this guy, at the request of David Perdue, he said, "Friend of mine's running for governor.", "What's his name?" And you know the rest. He was in fourth place, fifth place. I don't know, he was wait -- He was doing poorly. I endorse him, he went like a rocket ship and he won.”
pageContext.analysis: Gabriel Sterling, a Republican elections official in Georgia, tweeted in response to this comment: "No @realDonaldTrump, @BrianKempGA was already ahead in the polls in the @GaRepublicans Primary Runoff. He wasn't in 4th as you stated, since it was a runoff there were, in fact, only 2 candidates in that race. That's how runoffs work."
